about resume

Yixue Wang

I am a first-year Ph.D. student in Technology and Social Behavior program at Northwestern University, a joint program between the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science and the Department of Communication Studies. I am advised by Prof. Noshir Contractor.

My research interests are in computational social science, data science for social good and spatial analysis. I am particularly interested in how social networks, media exposure and geospatial environments influence propagation, reinforcement, or polarization of ideas and attitudes using network analysis, geospatial analysis, and machine learning.

I am a member of the Science of Networks in Communities (SONIC) research group at Northwestern. I am also a Data Science fellow at Northwestern Data Science Initiative.

Before joining the program, I studied Urban Informatics at Center for Urban Science and Progress at New York University and worked as a data analyst/engineer at HaystaqDNA developing classification modeling code and data preprocess/visualization/QA tools in Python.

Aug 27, 2017 Moved to Evanston for my Ph.D. in Technology and Social Behavior at Northwestern.
